So said  Vladimir Blagojevic  on  1/31/2003 --------------------

>Hi,
>
>I would like to invoke my unit test from ant and include java style 
>properties that are accesible from the Junit test code. For example,
the 
>file test_case1.properties includes:
>
>user.login=vladimir
>user.pass=junit
>...
>
>Then invoke ant test target "executetests" with the specified property

>file:
>
>ant executetests test_case1.properties
>
>As mentioned before properties should be accesible programatically
within 
>test case java code:
>
>Properties p = ....
>String userName = p.getProperty("user.login");
>...
>..
>
>
>What are the options to achieve this?

Are you looking for a tool that already does this? It's so simple, just
read the properties files yourself in your test code.

Write a couple of concrete instances of the tests, then refactor. A
little framework will evolve before your eyes.

Good luck.
